chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Sherman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges in accordance with jail rules, and may be served in any Wisconsin County pursuant to Wisconsin Statute 303.08(6). Defendant shall report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without any non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance may result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
Concurrent with: 21CF24

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall have no contact with the following named person(s) or their residence(s): FMA
Defendant shall comply with all conditions of bond

Defendant shall submit to and comply with any evaluation, assessment, counselling and/or treatment, as deemed appropriate by Agent and shall pay all applicable costs of same. To include sex offender treatment and follow up.

PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURT. If not timely paid in full, defendant may be ordered to spend one day in the county jail for each $50.00 amount owed, with huber privileges, and the remaining unpaid obligation will be docketed & enforced as a civil judgment against the defendant. The defendant shall keep the Clerk of Court's office advised of any change of address until the obligation is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
